item.title: 欧洲 欧洲央行、瑞士央行将降息，但幅度有多大？
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称日本央行下周倾向于保持利率稳定
item.description: 熟悉日本央行想法的五位消息人士称，日本央行倾向于在下周维持利率稳定，因为决策者更愿意花更多时间仔细研究海外风险和明年工资前景的线索。【原文：The Bank of Japan is leaning toward keeping interest rates steady next week as policymakers prefer to spend more time scrutinising overseas risks and clues on next year's wage outlook, said five sources familiar with its thinking.】

item.title: 澳大利亚下令对 Kraken 加密交易所运营商罚款 510 万美元
item.description: 澳大利亚企业监管部门周四表示，加密货币交易所 Kraken 的本地运营商已被勒令支付 800 万澳元（约合 510 万美元）的罚款，原因是该公司非法向该国 1100 多名客户发放信用贷款。【原文：Australia's corporate watchdog said on Thursday that the crypto exchange Kraken's local operator has been ordered to pay an A$8 million ($5.1 million) fine for unlawfully issuing a credit facility to more than 1,100 customers in the country.】

item.title: 独家报道申银万国 IPO：消息人士称，英国监管机构的决定因非政府组织的质疑而放缓
item.description: 据两位接近此事的消息人士透露，英国金融监管机构批准快速时尚零售商Shein上市的时间比往常要长，因为在中国维吾尔族权益组织对其上市提出质疑后，监管机构正在检查其供应链监督情况并评估法律风险。【原文：Britain's financial regulator is taking longer than usual to approve fast-fashion retailer Shein's IPO because it is checking its supply chain oversight and assessing legal risks after an advocacy group for China's Uyghur population challenged the listing, according to two sources close to the matter.】

item.title: 11 月泰国消费者信心指数上升
item.description: 周四的一项调查显示，受政府经济措施和旅游业的推动，11月份泰国消费者信心连续第二个月上升。【原文：Thai consumer confidence rose for a second consecutive month in November, bolstered by government economic measures and tourism, a survey showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，英伟达加大在华招聘力度，专注于人工智能驱动的汽车领域
item.description: 据彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周三报道，英伟达（Nvidia）今年在中国增加了数百名员工，以增强其研究能力并专注于新的自动驾驶技术。【原文：Nvidia has added hundreds of staff in China this year to enhance its research capabilities and focus on new autonomous driving technologies, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 大韩航空完成韩亚航空收购，成为亚洲最大的航空公司之一
item.description: 大韩航空（Korean Air）周四表示，该公司已经完成了对负债累累的韩国竞争对手韩亚航空（Asiana Airlines）的收购，这是朝着组建亚洲最大航空公司之一迈出的重要一步。【原文：Korean Air has completed its protracted purchase of indebted South Korean rival Asiana Airlines , the airline said on Thursday, a major step towards forming one of Asia's biggest carriers.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因美联储减息押注而反弹；澳元因就业数据而跳涨
item.description: 周四亚洲股市上涨，追随隔夜华尔街以科技股为主导的涨势，此前美国消费者通胀数据符合预期，巩固了对美联储下周降息的押注。【原文：Asian stocks gained on Thursday, tracking Wall Street's tech-led rally overnight after an as-expected reading of U.S. consumer inflation cemented bets for a Federal Reserve interest-rate cut next week.】

item.title: 有报道称中国正考虑削弱人民币汇率，人民币因此承压
item.description: 路透社报道称，中国正在考虑允许人民币走软，以抵御关税风险，人民币兑美元汇率周四承压，放弃了最初的一些涨幅。【原文：The yuan was under pressure against the dollar on Thursday, giving up some initial gains as markets digested a Reuters report that China is considering allowing a weaker yuan to weather the tariff risks.】

item.title: 尽管有降息押注，美元仍持稳；就业数据公布后，澳元上涨
item.description: 美元在上一交易日触及两周高点后，周四在窄幅区间内交投，受到美国国债收益率上升的支撑，即使市场人士押注美国联邦储备委员会将在下周降息。【原文：The U.S. dollar traded in a narrow range on Thursday after hitting a two-week high in the previous session, supported by a rise in U.S. Treasury yields even as market players bet the U.S. Federal Reserve will cut interest rates next week.】

item.title: 美国要求法院驳回对禁止 TikTok 的法律的延期请求
item.description: 美国司法部周三晚些时候要求美国上诉法院驳回 TikTok 提出的一项紧急请求，即暂时阻止一项要求其中国母公司字节跳动在 1 月 19 日前剥离短视频应用，否则将面临禁令的法律。【原文：The Justice Department late on Wednesday asked a U.S. appeals court to reject an emergency bid by TikTok to temporarily block a law that would require its Chinese parent company ByteDance to divest the short-video app by Jan. 19 or face a ban.】

item.title: 需求疲软抵消了制裁带来的供应风险，石油价格变化不大
item.description: 周四亚市早盘，油价变化不大，原因是需求疲软的预测以及美国汽油和馏分油库存增幅高于预期，抑制了欧盟新一轮制裁带来的涨幅，制裁威胁到俄罗斯的石油流动。【原文：Oil prices were little changed in early Asian trade on Thursday as forecasts of weak demand and a higher-than-expected rise in U.S. gasoline and distillate inventories stemmed gains from an additional round of European Union sanctions that threatened Russian oil flows.】

item.title: ServiceTitan 在美国的首次公开募股价格高于区间，将募集约 6.25 亿美元资金
item.description: 软件初创公司 ServiceTitan 周三表示，其美国首次公开募股的定价为每股 71 美元，此次首次公开募股可能会筹集到 6.248 亿美元。【原文：Software startup ServiceTitan priced its U.S. initial public offering at $71 per share, it said on Wednesday, in an IPO that could see it raise $624.8 million.】

item.title: 贝恩资本向印度尼西亚 Mayapada 医疗集团投资 1.57 亿美元
item.description: 美国私人投资公司贝恩资本（Bain Capital）周四发表联合声明称，已向印尼私人医疗保健公司 Mayapada Healthcare Group（即 Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya Tbk PT）投资 1.57 亿美元。【原文：U.S.-based private investment firm Bain Capital has invested $157 million in Indonesian private healthcare company Mayapada Healthcare Group, or Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya Tbk PT , according to a joint statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚11月失业率意外降至3.9
item.description: 澳大利亚 11 月份的就业率增幅超过预期，失业率则出现震荡下降，创下八个月来的新低，这表明劳动力市场的韧性远超决策者的预期。【原文：Australian employment rose by more than what was forecast in November, while the jobless rate posted a shock decline to an eight-month low indicating the labour market was proving far more resilient than policy makers expected.】

item.title: 部长表示，加拿大总理敦促对特朗普的关税威胁做出有力回应
item.description: 加拿大财政部长周三表示，一些加拿大总理正在敦促渥太华对即将上任的美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税威胁做出有力回应，并强调关键矿产和金属是美国依赖的产品。【原文：Some Canadian premiers are urging Ottawa to respond robustly to the threat of tariffs from incoming U.S. President Donald Trump and have highlighted critical minerals and metals as products that the U.S. relies on, Canada's Finance Minister said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 华尔街对通用汽车决定停用 Cruise 大多持乐观态度
item.description: 大多数华尔街分析师周三一致认为，通用汽车需要退出 Cruise 机器人出租车业务，但该汽车制造商的这一决定仍然是一个令人失望的结局，通用汽车曾将该业务吹捧为到 2030 年可能创造 500 亿美元收入的业务。【原文：General Motors needed to exit its Cruise robotaxi business, most Wall Street analysts agreed on Wednesday, but the automaker's decision to do so was still a disappointing end for an operation that GM had touted as a potential $50 billion revenue generator by 2030.】

item.title: 汇丰银行与世界银行国际金融公司为新兴市场推出 10 亿美元贸易融资计划
item.description: 汇丰银行和世界银行的国际金融公司（IFC）将联合为价值高达 10 亿美元的贸易交易提供资金，此举有助于填补新兴市场贸易融资的缺口。【原文：HSBC and the World Bank's International Finance Corporation (IFC) will jointly provide funding to trade transactions valued at up to $1 billion, in a move to help fill a gap in financing for emerging market trade.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院驳回纳斯达克董事会多元化规则
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周三裁定，纳斯达克不能强制要求在该交易所上市的公司董事会中必须有女性和少数族裔董事，或解释不这样做的原因。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Wednesday ruled that Nasdaq could not impose rules requiring companies listed on the exchange to have women and minority directors on their boards or explain why they do not.】

item.title: 7-Eleven 之战显示了日本公司家族纽带的韧性
item.description: 在 7-Eleven 母公司争夺战引发伊藤王朝 580 亿美元的收购要约之后，日本股东激进主义的兴起有望推动新一轮创始家族收购管理层的浪潮。【原文：A rise in shareholder activism in Japan is poised to fuel a new wave of management buyouts by founding families, after the battle for 7-Eleven's parent company prompted a $58 billion takeover offer from the Ito dynasty that built the retail giant.】

item.title: 路透社调查显示，多数日本企业预计特朗普当选总统将损害商业环境
item.description: 路透社的一项调查显示，近四分之三的日本公司预计唐纳德-特朗普下一任美国总统任期将对其商业环境产生负面影响，理由是计划提高关税和中美贸易紧张局势令人担忧。【原文：Nearly three-quarters of Japanese companies expect Donald Trump's next term as U.S. president to have a negative impact on their business environment, citing planned tariff hikes and U.S.-China trade tensions as causes of concern, a Reuters survey showed.】

item.title: 拉扎德预计交易将回暖，关税将有度
item.description: 投资银行拉扎德（Lazard）首席执行官彼得-奥尔萨格（Peter Orszag）预计，在私募股权投资活动的推动下，交易势头将持续到明年。【原文：Investment bank Lazard's CEO, Peter Orszag, predicted a surge in dealmaking momentum to continue into next year, helped by private equity activity.】

item.title: 墨西哥纽蒙特公司对提高采矿特许权使用费的谈判持乐观态度
item.description: 纽蒙特墨西哥分部周三表示，该公司看到了墨西哥政府 "对话的开放性"，因为拟议中的采矿特许权使用费上调有可能阻碍数十亿美元的投资。【原文：Newmont's Mexican division said on Wednesday it sees an "openness for dialogue" from the Mexican government, amid the proposed increase in mining royalties, which could potentially hinder billions of dollars in investments.】

item.title: 澳大利亚计划出台新规，强制大科技公司继续向新闻机构付费
item.description: 据当地媒体报道，澳大利亚中左翼政府周四将公布新规定，如果大型科技公司拒绝继续为其平台上托管的新闻内容向澳大利亚媒体公司支付费用，政府将对这些公司处以罚款。【原文：Australia's centre-left government on Thursday will unveil new rules that could impose fines on Big Tech companies if they refuse to continue to pay Australian media firms for news content hosted on their platforms, local media reported.】

item.title: 纽约时报》技术公会与公司就三年合同达成临时协议
item.description: 纽约新闻工会（NewsGuild of New York）周三表示，该工会已与《纽约时报》就为期三年的合同达成临时协议，此前《纽约时报》的 600 多名技术工人于 11 月举行了为期一周的罢工。【原文：The NewsGuild of New York said on Wednesday it had reached a tentative deal on a three-year contract with the New York Times , after more than 600 tech workers at NYT went on a week-long strike in November.】

item.title: 巴西央行加息幅度超出预期，预示未来将采取更多紧缩措施
item.description: 巴西央行周三将利率上调了100个基点，幅度超过预期，并指出将在未来两次会议上进行相应的加息，这表明由政府任命的新行长不会削弱央行与通胀作斗争的决心。【原文：Brazil's central bank raised interest rates by a greater-than-expected 100 basis points on Wednesday and pointed to matching hikes for the next two meetings, signaling a shift to a new government-named governor will not weaken its determination to battle inflation.】

item.title: 早间竞价：关注中国外汇市场，市场因美联储希望而大涨
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 人工智能提高了银行的生产力，但要从中赚钱却是个挑战
item.description: 在纽约举行的路透社 Next 会议上，与会专家表示，人工智能有望大幅提高银行的生产力，但迄今为止，要从这项技术中赚钱还比较困难。【原文：Artificial intelligence is expected to show big gains in productivity at banks, panelists said at the Reuters Next conference in New York, but it has so far been harder to make money from the technology.】

item.title: 微软预计 2025 年第二季度将因通用汽车退出 Cruise 计提 8 亿美元减值费用
item.description: 微软周三在一份文件中表示，预计2025财年第二季度将因通用汽车（General Motors）退出Cruise自动驾驶业务而计提约8亿美元的减值费用。 这家科技巨头在周三提交的一份文件中表示，由于通用汽车退出 Cruise 自动驾驶业务，微软预计将在 2025 财年第二季度计提约 8 亿美元的减值费用。【原文：Microsoft expects to record an impairment charge of around $800 million in the second quarter of fiscal year 2025 over General Motors' exit of the Cruise autonomous driving business, the tech giant said in a filing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 大众汽车为田纳西州工厂工人在四年内加薪 14
item.description: 大众汽车公司周三表示，将在四年内为田纳西州装配厂新加入工会的工人增加 14% 的工资，并提供利润分享。【原文：Volkswagen said Wednesday it is offering its newly unionized workers at its Tennessee assembly plant a 14% wage increase over four years and profit sharing.】
